result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquawn Antwon Euell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Laquawn Antwon Euell.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on a Hearing on medication order.  State does not challenge Dr. Murtaugh's request for medication order.  Defense does challenge Dr. Murtaugh request for medication order. Parties stipulate to the qualifications of the doctor as an expert. Court qualified Dr. Murtaugh to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Kevin Murtaugh.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Murtaugh, and testimony of Dr. Murtaugh, Court found the defendant is mentally ill and not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment. Court grants the medication order recommended by Dr. Murtaugh. Court further ordered The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  AMENDED Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  Case remains calendared for a Return of Doctor's Report on December 16, 2022 at 8:30am in Branch 11.

Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Laquawn Antwon Euell.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a hearing on medication order. For reasons stated on the record, defendant is unable to appear. Court adjourns matter for CAUSE for a Hearing on Proposed Medication Order. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Laquawn Antwon Euell.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. Thomas DeBoer and Kevin Murtaugh appeared for Mendota Mental Health Institute. Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. DeBoer report.  Defense does challenge Dr. DeBoer report.  Court qualified Dr. DeBoer to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Thomas DeBoer.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. DeBoer, and testimony of Dr. DeBoer, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. The proceedings are suspended. The defendant is committed on 09-20-2022 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment. The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility FORTHWITH.  
Medication order is held open to be determined at the next scheduled court date.  Court ordered case adjourned hearing on medication order and for return on doctor's report in Branch 11. 

Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Order to Treat Letter.  Received and Filed.  nk
EUELL Competency Report.  Received and Filed. nk
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Laquawn Antwon Euell.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return. Defendant's appearance is waived. Parties do not contest the report.  The Court found that an inpatient examination is necessary and committed the defendant to
for a competency examination and report pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2)(3) of Wisconsin Statutes. Court orders the defendant remanded for in patient evaluation at one of the two state mental health institutes FORTHWITH.  Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 11.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Laquawn Antwon Euell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laquawn Antwon Euell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case recalled at 10:58:  Same appearances.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
